description: Minor material amendment (S.73) to vary condition no.1 (approved plans) pursuant to planning permission reference  192101FUL dated 28/08/2019  for' Retention of single storey rear extension to rear of 82-86 Horsenden Lane North for place of worship (D1 Use Class) and ancillary office associated with the change of use to ground floor of No. 86 from retail shop (A1 Use Class) to place of worship (D1 Use Class) including associated cycle storage and refuse storage provision; and retention of relocated external staircase to rear of No. 86 (Retrospective) (Joint Application) ' Variation seeking to approve the installation of a roof lantern into extension
decision_conditions: The development permitted is approved in accordance with drawing title number(s) Site Location Plan ref. MB/PLAN/007; Block Plan ref. MB/PLAN/008; Existing Ground Floor Plan ref. MB/PLAN/005; Existing Rear Elevations ref. MB/PLAN/001; Existing Side Elevations ref. MB/PLAN/003; Proposed Ground Floor Plan ref. MB/PLAN/007/REV-A; Proposed Rear Elevation ref. MB/PLAN/002; Proposed Side Elevations ref. MB/PLAN/004/REV-A. Plans amended by VARIATION/PLAN/001 (Existing Ground Floor Plan) and VARIATION/PLAN/002 (Existing Side Elevations)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, in the interest of proper planning.

| Noise mitigation measures shall be installed in the ceiling between the development hereby approved and the dwellings above, and between the development hereby approved and the adjacent residences to achieve an acoustic standard of NR 25 Leq 5 mins (octaves) or NR 20 Leq 5 mins (one-third octaves) inside a bedroom and NR 30 Leq 5 mins (octaves) or NR 25 Leq 5 mins (one-third octaves) inside a habitable room when noise is generated from the commercial use.  The mitigation measures shall be implemented prior to the commencement of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the occupiers of the above residential premises and adjacent residential premises, in accordance with Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10, policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 7.14 & 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
| No amplified voice, music or other sound shall be permitted within the development hereby approved, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason:  In the interests of the living conditions of the occupiers of the above residential premises and adjacent residential premises, in accordance with Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10, policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 7.14 & 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 No.596 the development shall only be used for the D1 use (place of worship) at the site and not for any other use.
Reason: To accord with the terms of the application and to protect the provision of social infrastructure uses, in accordance with policies 3.16 and 3.19 of the London Plan (2016).
| Ensure refuse and recycling storage, and sheltered and secure cycle storage  are provided and brought into use prior to commencement of the development permitted and retained thereafter.

Reason:  To ensure adequate arrangements are provided for the storage and collection of refuse and recycables, and cycle parking is provided within the development in accordance with policies 5.16 and 6.9 of the London Plan (2016); and Ealing's Sustainable Transport for New Development SPG (2012).

| The use of the building shall be as a place of worship (D1) and the hours of operation at the building shall be from 6am to 11pm, except during the Islamic month of Ramadan, whereby the hours of operation shall be permitted in accordance with those hours issued by the Regent's Park Mosque.  During the Islamic Month of Ramadan the use of the building shall be restricted to a maximum of ten people on site at any time for the duration of the hours before 6am and after 11pm.
Reason:  To safeguard the amenity of adjacent residents and the area generally, in accordance with policies with policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
